review_body: On a recent business trip to NY I was looking for a strategically located hotel near Manhattan. I came across Off Soho by chance and after reading a few reviews, decided to give them a chance. When I first arrived, I disnt know what to expect judging from the exterior, but as soon as I walked in, I really like the vibe. My room was a three room suite with hardwood floor, spacious en suite bathroom, and queen size bed. The room was exceptionally clean, the temperature perfect, and quiet other than the typical street noise. The desk manager Gabe was first rate and took vare of my every need. I will definitely stay with them again!

Friends came to meet us in the room before going out to eat. The clerk rudely raised his voice demanding that people wait in the lobby and did not let our friends in the room. He said we would be too loud because they were shared rooms. It was 9:00pm on a Saturday and there was no curfew or quiet hours mentioned on the website. He “allowed” us 20 minutes in the room and threatened to throw us out if we were late. Had the economy suite for 2, which consisted of 2 foot-wide beds and a room the size of a queen bed.

We had booked to stay in this accommodation, however when we got there we realised that the area was super dodgy/sketchy. The room itself was ok- what you would expect from a budget hotel. Everything was clean. However when we went for a walk, we did not feel safe. We ended up cancelling our reservation and moving to another hotel.

Pros:location is perfect, easy 5-10mins walk to various subway stations, and near to all the charming streets full of fine cafes, restaurants and shops that come so alive on weekends! Suites are roomy, with big bathroom, spacious kitchen with stove stop, kettle, microwave and fridge, Ikea sofa bed in living room and spacious bedroom. Reception staff are approachable and easy going. Fresh towels changed everyday, sheets changed every other day, lift landing on every floor, and coin operated washer dryer in basement. Suite room has iron and ironing board.Cons:The aircon in bedroom was very loud and noisy. One of the ceiling light metal rim fell and almost hit our head. Clothes hanger was faulty and housekeeping didn't fix it. Housekeeping kept giving us big bottles of hair conditioners and small tubes of random brand shampoos. Bathroom window had a missing window blind panel, we had to put a cereal box cover to block the opening. Hope the property will look into all these.Will stay here again if the aircon are fixed and does not make loud noises.

We stayed five nights in an Economy Suite. The bedroom was very tight, and we shared a kitchen and bath with another bedroom, and it was not a problem. It is located conveniently to subways, and the pricing is OK, but don't expect anything special unless you upgrade. The beds are very comfortable, and the staff is very pleasant and accommodating. If you want your bedding changed, you need to let the desk know and leave a key - otherwise only just the kitchen and bathroom are cleaned daily, and towels changed out.

We spent 5 nights at this place; it is a ageing 'Dump'. Our unit was certainly not as pictured on the website or in the promotional videos. The place is old and it shows its age everywhere you look – the photos are not representative of all units!! There maybe one or a few units that have been refurbished, but we didn't stay in one; nor did we see any through open doors. Our stay started with the toilet blocking and water flooding all over the bathroom floor (and the manager left the rubber plunger with us "just in case it happens again"!!).The front door could not be accessed with the key; the gym was ‘unavailable’; the towels are old, small and thin. The kitchen is out of the 1960’s with little amenity - the paint and veneer on the cupboards and drawers is peeling. There is no electric kettle (you have to heat a kettle on old gas stove, the ignition system of which has had it!!). We had to make up our bed when we arrived (sheets and blankets were provided). You have to fight for a tea towel. There was no plug for the kitchen sink. The TV in our room was minuscule and had no news channels programmed into it – no CNN even!! The website promotes a Limo service from JFK, but it is not organised by the management (our travel agent tried in vain to have them organise a limo - but they can't or won't) and I overheard a couple trying to organise the service back to JFK - with no success and much frustration. We could not in good faith recommend this place to anyone and would certainly never go back.On the plus side - towels were replaced daily, and the housekeeping staff were most helpful.

Awesome location in lower Manhattan. Rooms are small but clean and comfortable. Staff are happy to help with admin tasks such as printing etc. Highly recommended if you are looking for a cheap, great value hotel in a prime location in lower Manhattan.

In case you can think of OSS as a room or apartment owned by good friends who let you stay there at minimal cost ($150 per night), it does not get better. The rooms are clean, the beds comfortable. Stock your fridge with the basics from Wholefoods nearby.The location is brilliant, close to the true NYC feel, great restaurants, cute shops, a bit rough still. During our week visit we had our children stay at the modern CitizenM. We had more space, a kitchenette and a separate bathroom. Privacy. We are spoiled travelers but in NYC, and when there for more than 2 or 3 days, we would much rather spend our money on food, theater and the arts. Have the feeling to live in NYC and not be in all the same aquarium style high-rises. You can still have a drink on these rooftops or work in their lobbies if you like. OSS is clean and the staff suits the place excellently. Not hipsters but beautiful New Yorkers. For breakfast we found Ceci-Cela (same block literally on other side) to be one of the best options in the city. Relaxed, affordable and great quality French bakery. We were there every morning.The location is within minutes walking from essential subway lines. Grand, Bowery, Spring, Prince. You can be on Broadway or in Central Park in 15 minutes. Uber was there always within 2 minutes. Don't forget to visit ICP basically next door.

The hotel was clean and spacious. I originally booked the Deluxe Suite, which I guess only comes with two twin beds and a futon (even though the pictures show that there's a queen bed, that's actually an upgraded room) - but when I checked in, I asked for that configuration and the front-desk guy was able to upgrade me to it, which was very nice of him. The location is perfect! Very close to Chinatown, soho shops, etc.. I would definitely stay here again.

If you want to feel like a NewYorker , this is the place. Sure it was a bit noisy but thats part of the downtown New York charm. Wahlid, the hotel night manager, as well as the rest of the friendly staff made us feel at home and was very helpful on all occasions. The rooms are comfortable and homey. The location of the hotel is perfect and walking distances from most downtown areas (Soho, Nolita, Chinatown, Little Italy, etc) In all we had a great and comfortable time. Thx WAWA !!

Location is convenient and the lobby and corridors look nice and renovated. That's all that's good about this hotel. If you appreciate a good night's sleep then you won't find it here. The neighbourhood is *unbelievably* noisy with ongoing very loud construction work starting every morning at 7am, and groups of screaming people spilling out of bars next door until very late at night - even on weekdays. The windows do not filter out the noise. The room was tiny - no space for a chair or a desk, hardly space to walk around and open the suitcase. The floors are very old and the walls are thin which means that when a person next door walks around your bed shakes. Our fire alarm started beeping very loudly and intermittently at 5am, it took more than an hour and a half and four phone-calls for the (not friendly) staff at reception to respond and sort it out - they did not even apologise. The kitchen is small and there isn't even paper roll, coffee or filters for the coffee maker so you'll have to buy everything yourself. The bathroom is clean and the cleaning staff are friendly.

We made a mistake with the reservation, but the person on the reception helped us correct it without any consequences for us. Thank you! We needed only one night for three people, and this was the most convenient and budget-friendly option.

Very nice place to stay in Manhattan. Subway stations near by and some attrations that you could go by foot. We were in 4 (2 under 16) and the accomodations were great. Very functional and value for money.

Reasonable price and good location. Just make sure to watch the type of room you book. A suite doesn’t mean you’re getting a better room. It means sharing a bathroom. Still, a great location and price for SoHo

This was a good place for our family of 5 to stay. 1 room with twin - very comfortable beds and 1 room beside it with a pull out double sofa bed (not too comfortable) and we also paid $46 I think extra per night for a further roll out single bed which I thought was very steep. Good cooking facility's, fridge, microwave. Nice bathroom. Quite quiet considering it's manhattan. Downside area a little run down and edgy outside but still felt safe enough to walk around. Very near little italy and chinatown. Good local shop and bakery nearby which is handy for breakfast.

I have not a lot of good things to say about Off Soho Suites.I stayed there like 15 years ago and remember it being a dump. It was spacious by NYC standards but was not very nice.Fast forward to a recent visit when my friend said they had redone their rooms, so I said sure let's try it. It's in a great location, so they have that going for them.It's renovated but it's still not that nice. It's an old building and there's a bunch of problems, like slow hot water, a floor that's seen centuries of dirty feet, and bedding that came from the dollar store.But the biggest problem with our visit was the construction right outside of our window. It woke us up at precisely 7am on the first morning of our vacation, ruining the day. Now I get it, this is NYC, there's a lot of noise. I've dealt with that before. But not construction of a new building right outside our window.Off Soho Suites gets a low rating for how poorly they dealt with the situation. We asked the front desk to move rooms and were told they were entirely sold out. That may be the case, but we are asking to move rooms. Why should we have to suffer the noise when other guests that haven't arrived don't? Only two rooms per floor had windows over the construction, so we could be put into 85% of the hotel rooms and be fine. But they wouldn't move us. They only offered a more expensive room for $200 more per night. Uhh, no.So every morning we were woken up at 7am, pretty much ruining a lot of enjoyment of my time in NYC. The icing on the cake was the last day another hotel front desk clerk telling us we should have told them about the problem and they would have moved us rooms. Are you friggin' kidding me?

This was my first time to NYC and this place made me feel like I was getting an authentic experience. The hotel is tucked in an ally, next to restaurants and other businesses. It has an old-school feel to it but is very clean and comfortable. It looks like it was an apartment building that was converted, so it is more spacious than a typical hotel room and had a full kitchen. Overall, this place is nothing fancy, but I would go back again in a similar travel situation.

Location is across the street from SOHO and hence good price for this area. Spacious apartment very clean and reasonably furnished. Catering equipment limited. Staff very helpful and friendly. Lots of restaurants and Wholefoods. nearby as well as several subway choices. Recommended

The room was more of a 1 bedroom apartment. Ir has a kitchen and living room with a futon that pylls down for another bed. My family if 4 slept comfortably. The heat was in when we arrived, which was nice considering how cold it was. The room was not spectacular or new, but it was comfortable. Our room was on the end opposite the street but next to a beer garden, so the patrons there were pretty loud when we were trying to sleep. Other than that, we had a pleasant stay and the price was right.

we picked this hotel as we wanted a suite and not to pay 400 a night up in Times Square!! staff were friendly and accommodating..towels and beds changed daily.. yes it is a bit old..and yes its noisy (cars beep all night driving by but thats NY!!) but overall we were happy with our stay..about a 7 min walk to subway.. 5 min walk to shops around soho.. Wifi was not really working while we were there..probably biggest downside.. but i would recommend..

Suites are large with kitchen and living room in addition to bedroom and bathroom. Location is good and within 5-10 mins walk of the B,D,F,J,M,Z,4,6 subway lines. There's no breakfast or room service, but you do have a full kitchen if you have the time to go grocery shopping.

Wonderful Friendly staff, spacious clean suites, ideal down town location and fantastic value. Great bar next door (lauralye) and across the road too (freemans). Really handy for soho spots and 3 subway stations a few block away. We will definitely be back.

We all know how expensive New York is but for 200€ per night you expect a decent hotel. This one is old, mouldy and noisy (ac is horribly noisy).Old spreadsheets and bed covers...It was saved from complete desaster due to one of THE recepcionists and the great location

We stayed in this property, a one bedroom suite for 8 nights in early October.We weren't expecting a high end apartment but was pleasantly surprised at the location & size of our suite. Price was definitely a major consideration when we picked this property. When one visits New York City it is for the city & what it offers. Off Soho Suites is great for recharging.Wifi, although complementary, was woeful at best, so do not rely on it at all.A/C are built into the windows, so are noisey units. There is construction going on all around so do not expect silence, I would recommend ear buds.Fresh clean towels added & garbage removed each day.Literary a 5-min walk to Whole Foods Market, cnr Chrystie St & E Houston St.

Arrived at this seemingly off the radar hotel. Suspicious check in. Off to room 601. Non working 15+ year old TV. Non working to poor internet. Paid Premium Wifi even worse. Then things got fun. Street noise from the local bars and a block long line for $25 Morgensterns Ice Cream Cones. Woke the following morning covered in Bed Bug Bites, could not check out fast enough with equally nightmarish Hotels.com HELL!

review_body: This appears to be an older apartment building that has been renovated to be a hotel, so the unit has a living space with small kitchen, bedroom and bathroom. It's clean, comfortable and has an elevator. It's an easy walk to Little Italy and Chinatown, and to a couple different subway stations. We found the taking the B or D trains out of Grand St. station got us pretty much everywhere we wanted to go. BUT just a heads up about visiting in the summer.. the area stinks! Not the hotel, but all of the surrounding streets had trash mounded up daily, and with the brutal heat, it was nasty!

I was coming in to New York to see a couple of shows and meet up with friends and hang out on a Tuesday and Wednesday, than leave on Thursday. A friend was coming in from out of town as well and we were going to stay together, and a third from California possibly. The one bedroom suite was the perfect accommodation for us. In the nice sized bedroom were two individual beds, a decent sized closet with hangars and a safe, plus a window and room a/c. The living room had a queen sized futon, a table, some chairs, and a nice useful kitchen, plus more a/c. It was a great space for three people to hang out in. And the bathroom was very clean and spacious. Now don't think a brand spanking new big room like you might get at a Marriott. But it was as clean as a Marriott, and for East Village standards, spacious, and also very quiet. The service was excellent! I kept phoning them to change arrangements, and on every ring they were more than gracious. Then when I got there the man at the desk, one of the recipients of my calls, treated me like an old acquaintance and was very personal and friendly and efficient. He also made sure that plenty of towels, shampoo, etc was brought up, and the woman who cleaned the room was also very accommodating making sure that all of our needs were met. There are a couple of vending machines on site, but I didn't check out to see if there were any other amenities. The front desk on departure was happy to print my boarding pass for me. I loved the location. The neighborhood doesn't lack for places to eat, shop, or be entertained. This block of Rivington though was very quiet, which reflected in how quiet the hotel seemed to be at night. I will definitely come back and stay here when in this part of NYC.

my wife and I .. as well as business associates, have been staying at the Off Soho Suites Hotel fore over 7 years .. at least twice a year. The management and staff are superb and is the reason we keep coming back over and over again.. Of course the Hotel is very nice.. every room a full suite .. well appointed and maintained.. its our home away from home.. A number of times my wife must travel to NY for business .. and I know that she will be well looked after and in safe hands by the personalities of the management at the hotel .. and it is that which draws us back over and over again .. The off soho suites is our home away from home. Thank you Gabe and all.

I was very leery of booking a hotel this cheap in New York City. To be honest I was expecting it to be more like a hostel. But my husband wanted to be close to a wedding were attending in Nolita, so that's why we booked it. We were VERY pleasantly surprised. Our room was huge, with a living room, full kitchen and bedroom. Also, it was spotless! Of course, not the 4Seasons, but if you're looking for a really nice "no frills "hotel with a great price and a great location, look no further. We Loved the Off Soho Suites, would recommend it, and would definitely stay there again!

Stayed here with my mum for six nights. Apartment was clean and quiet. Though kitchen was a bit shabby. Gas cooker so could be sensible for them to provide a safe kitchen lighter. Was quite expensive but guess that's NYC. Staff mostly friendly apart from the older male receptionist during the day who could be quite rude and was rude when I called prior to my stay. Maid came every day and did a thorough job. Only complaint would be that the door between rooms in the apartment was paper thin and didn't fit the door frame - the reason I booked (and why I called prior to staying there) was that the rooms needed to be separate. Situation was made difficult because the door didn't keep snoring noises out and thus had to sleep with the air con on loud to drown out the noise. This was disappointing for the money. Doesn't have a great selection of TV channels, but you shouldn't be watching TV when there's NYC to discover. In a great location, three blocks from the subway and great restaurants and lively bars near by, as well as the famous Morgensterns ice cream shop. Felt like a safe area. Good free wifi.

Wonderful hotel, perfect location. For the money I paid, everything was great! Super spacious, comfortable for two couples. A small kitchen. Excellent area, close to Little Italy and Chinatown. It is not a luxury hotel, but it is very clean and excellent cost-benefit.

For the amount you pay, it's hard to complain about Off Soho Suites. It's not luxurious but we didn't pay the money to stay somewhere luxurious - this is substance over style. Our one bed deluxe suite had a well-furnished kitchen, a big bathroom and more than enough space for four people (two couples). The hotel is clean and well-presented, especially in the communal areas. The staff are so friendly and helpful. Location is fantastic - subway lines within a couple of minutes walk and all the bars / restaurants / coffee shops you could need. The downsides were that the beds were not particularly comfortable (especially the sofa bed) and the heating in the rooms couldn't be controlled, so it was often a little too hot or a little too cold. The shower was either scalding or freezing and wouldn't stay in its stand. There was little natural light in the room, and only big main lights, no lamps. However, for the price of the room, this hotel is excellent value and ideal for a few nights stay in NYC. If you are looking for something more luxurious, you'll have to spend a lot more money.

Very charming, clean & comfortable. The management was very nice. Location was excellent! Near Little Italy & China Town. Plenty of restaurants & shopping in walking distance. There were four girls & we all loved the place & the price!!

This is a small hotel next to Soho, walkable distance also to Little Italy and Chinatown. We were able to get a reasonable rate for the family, for a 2 rooms suite. The room itself needed some renovation, several details were quite old, but didn't really created an issue.The only issue was with the heating, it was a central heating system, and the room was extremely hot, at some point we opened the windows (on winter!).But the team was extremely friendly, we felt really welcome and comfortable in the hotel. It is within walkable distance from Soho, several subway stations around, good restaurants and bars. Good location for people willing to visit Manhattan, away from Times Square.

We ended up at this hotel after our Air BNB fell through. Off Soho Suites was willing to book us last minute for two nights. We had a perfectly reasonable stay here -- yes, the rooms are older and much more dinged up than shown in the pictures. But our room was clean and perfectly comfortable.

A few friends and I were looking for a place to say in NYC to see a show and do some shopping in December. Off SOHO Suites was a great find -- it's close to boutique shopping and restaurants in Little Italy, it's an easy cab or subway ride uptown to go to the theater, there's a public parking garage just a couple blocks away, and, Gabe, who worked the front desk and checked us in, couldn't have been more kind and helpful. The room had two full beds and a sleep sofa and a kitchenette. The room was comfortable and clean enough - not fancy - but met our needs for this trip.

The rooms are not exactly spacious, but everything is clean and and there is just enough space for all of the things a travel needs; and the staff are friendly and helpful.The location of the hotel is a big plus - it's both close to the metro and is located in the cool Soho neighborhood with lots of places to hang out at.

New York has cast a spell on me that I can't seem to shake. For the past six years, I've visited this marvelous city at least once a year. It's an insatiable love that can never be quenched. A part of your experience here is choosing the right place to stay. I've stayed at five star hotels such as the Ritz Carlton in Battery Park and Trump Soho. Then I stumbled upon this gem 4 years ago and haven't stayed anywhere since. Off Soho Suites is my home! The treatment that I receive from Gabe, Ralph, and Will is incomparable to any hotel within the city. I'm much more than a guest, I'm family. It's astonishing that I visit once a year and they know me by name. I was able to request a room of my choice with such a great view, by simply just asking. I appreciate the fact that I will pay for my room upon check in. No payments or deposits are required up front and canceling reservations are also not a hassle.If you're ever wondering how it would be to have an apartment in the city--this is the closet experience that you will have. The rooms are quite spacious, with a separation of the bedroom and kitchen/dining area. Now, having a fully stocked kitchen with pots, utensils, coffee maker, toaster, microwave, a refrigerator and stove is a life savior in a city that can be quite expensive. Whole Foods is conveniently located around the corner. You can always buy breakfast items to whip up very quickly in the morning. I love this place and what it represents. Make sure that when you're thinking of visiting New York City, that you try this place out at least once. I guarantee that you'll fall in love with it, just as much as I have.

Booked a suite online and didn't know what to expect from the photos and descriptions. I was pleasantly surprised. Spacious and clean and right next door to the Loreley Beer Garden. Great location in the East Village and the price was very fair. Parking garages are a number of blocks away but iPark was relatively cheap for the weekend. The owner/manager of the hotel is obviously obsessed with keeping the place clean, including the sidewalk out front. They washed it early in the morning and were out there like every hour with a leaf blower keeping it clean. Very good experience and will definitely stay there again in the future.

It's not the Grand Hyatt, but Off-Soho Suites is a fine choice for a group that needs a private bedroom plus sleeping accommodations in a separate room. The hotel was clean, staff friendly, and the location is within walking distance of the real New York experiences to be found in the Lower East Side, Nolita and the East Village. Five subway lines going in all directions are within a 10 minute walk. The price for a suite sleeping four was on a par with a typical double room in the Times Square area.

I stayed here with my mother. I was quite disappointed in my stay because the room was tiny and the bathroom/kitchen were shared. These details were not conveyed to me. The hotel experience was more like a hostel.On the flip side, the front desk was very nice and they accommodated early check-in.

review_body: The suite we had was a little tired and not luxury at all, BUT a really cool area between little Italy and Chinatown, lots of boutiques and restaurants, gives you a real feel for NY. You get a large double futon in one room, kitchenette, decent bathroom and double bedroom for same price as one double in the horror of times sq! Great way to cut costs travelling with friends or family. Easy walking to Bloomingdales, and subway, highly recommend Fiat tiny Italian cafe near Spring if eating out. Oh and fresh towels and room tidy every day.

Newcastle upon Tyne, United Kingdom

review_body: So I got a great deal on a room. I was visiting clients and my wife joined me. She went to check in at 4pm, but her card was declined. The owner would not let her get into the room until 'her husband showed him the actual card'. I called the hotel and spoke to him and he let her in immediately. Some places a husband over the phone matters more than a wife in person... Unpleasant to boot.So she goes to the room and realizes that it is a tiny room with a shared bath. Yikes! I did not know that. I ask for a suite upgrade and swallow the gut-churning fee. The suite was much larger, but still a bit slummy. Cigarette smoke smell from previous guests as well as sticky floors did not help.The location, although a nice neighborhood, was loud. Our room window was a stone-throw away from some loud club or restaurant that kept us up. I love SOHO. Too bad I will be looking for another place next time.

Rooms are somewhat worn down, but it works. For New york the apartment we had was quite big with enough room for luggage and people with feeling claustrophobic. Reception emplyees are nice. The order of Twin beds that you are asked to make (Queen or twin bed) did not really go through, but we managed with an extra bed that we had free of charge. Location is absolutely perfect, close to everything. Noise from street was not audible, the fridge was however quite noisy.

Great value apartments brilliantly located on the edge of Soho, Chinatown and Little Italy - the heart of the lower east side renaissance and regrowth. Really buzzy area - nearest shops are a florist, a German bierkeller (loreley - great!) an awesome ice cream parlour (morgansterns) and a late night barbers - an eclectic mix that really sums the area up. And the area is why you go here. Restaurants, bars, cafe culture and everything in between. We have stayed in the more traditional tourist centres in Manhattan but this was way better as a base. Subway lols go everywhere and most lines are accessible within a block or two. The apartments themselves are a little dated but clean and huge for the price. The front desk guys are really helpful and the noise is minimal especially if you get a suite at the back. Great value at the price for Manhattan.

We stayed at Off Soho Suites in a room that shared a bathroom and kitchen with one other room. The suite containing the 2 bedrooms was secured from other guests by a main door. At no time did the sharing of the facilities pose a major problem and at times during the week we were there, the other bedroom was empty so we had the space to ourselves. This is very cheap and basic accommodation in a very expensive city. The location is right in the thick of things on the LES with the Subway and Wholefoods in 5 minutes walking distance.The team of guys on the Concierge desk were always extremely helpful and it is manned 24/7 making late check ins a breeze and adding to the security. The bedroom space was very small and cramped with not much storage but the beds were comfortable and clean. An excellent option for those looking for budget accomm. We would definite come back.Jenni & Tess

Found this suites hotel while looking for last minute business travel for a party of 3 needing two rooms at a reasonable price. We felt lucky after we checked in because the rooms are gigantic, equipped with full kitchen, large living room and nice bedroom and bath. A bit dated in decor, but hard to beat a room this size in Soho for this price.

We stayed here in two rooms for a bachelorette party. There was plenty of room for all of us. They have futons in the "living room" that you can fit 2-3 people on and are comfortable. The beds, pillows, and blankets are really clean. Hardwood/tile floors make it less gross than carpets would be. Bathroom and kitchen are dated but just fine. Lobby and hotel staff are very nice and accommodating!

Would recommend this hotel It's in a good position just off the Bowery near little Italy and Chinatown. Easy to use navigate from a top German bar next door and short walk to the subway Room was big enough for us as it had a separate bedroom and the kids slept on the sofa bedKitchen was handy after a big day exploring or a late start for a day out.

I stayed here in April with 5 other people for a bachelorette party. We chose the hotel because of its proximity to other spots we wanted to hit up while we were in town, and due to the fact that it was affordable for everyone's budget. First of all, the man who checked us into our rooms was very nice and friendly. Definitely a good way to start the trip. The rooms (we needed 2) were adequate. While this isn't the newest hotel you'll see, the rooms appeared to be clean. Yes, the appliances are a little dated. We didn't use the kitchen to cook though, so it wasn't an issue. If traveling with a group, I would definitely recommend if you are on a budget.

The hotel is in a convenient location, near to Chinatown and to a few subway stations. The suites were spacious, and very comfortable. It is showing its age though, and the decor & appliances are a little jaded. The kitchen is of a good size but the cabinets are older looking. There is a large refrigerator and cooktop. The adjacent bathroom was adequately maintained and has a bathtub and shower. Living area has a comfortable sofa, and an small dining table with stools. There are air conditioning units in the lounge and in the bedroom, but they were loud to operate. There were unfinished construction works around the premises, so the courtyard outlooks were not inviting. There common lounge was a nice area to hang out and there were information pamphlets & maps available which I thought was a nice touch. On the premises, there were also vending machines, coin-operated guest laundry, and a fitness centre. There were also many restaurants, bars nearby and a very popular ice cream parlour around the corner, as well as a convenience store. Not a bad place but could do with some updating, and finishing touches.

I booked a room for one night for two people, (for over $200) it stated shared but not "shared bathroom" however it did state that all rooms have shower/tub combination.Well the reality is as follows:There is no shower and toilet in the room, it is shared between two rooms. We were offered an upgrade for additional modest amount of $200.The room is so small that there is no space for language, actually besides the two twin beds there is no space at all.It has an Very old and noisy AC that blows on you, doesn't cool and impossible to sleep withThe wifi was connecting but couldn't support emails or other basic operations.The Windows are so old and not insulated which makes the street noise too load to allow sleep.Even the phone they placed in the room was disconnected, so you cannot call the front desk or make emergency calls.Think twice and more before booking this hotel!!!

I guess you get what you pay for!Don't expect a lot but for the price it's good value.Room was clean and comfortable. Apartment was serviced daily. Fairly spacious with a foldout couch in living room. In general fairly tired and the kitchen & bathroom especially need urgent refreshing. The shower / bath and basin would not drain freely and towels were of poor quality. Location was not so great for our family, which included 2 teenagers and meant we could not enter the various bar eatery options nearby. There were however restaurants around and many in neighbouring Little Italy and Chinatown. There is a huge Whole Foods very close by which has everything you need including many pre-cooked food options. Subway is relatively nearby but that said the hotel still not in the easiest location to get in and out of when travelling around Manhattan.Staff were really friendly and helpful.All in all a satisfactory little place but nothing special.

Good price, good location. The hotel is a little bit old, but it's clean, comfortable and has a good space. It's also clode to a subway station. Soho is a very nice place to stay. Very good value for money.

My stay there was great as expected. The staff alone make it such a wonderful experience and after my last stay 3 years ago, the same staff are there, the same gracious spirit, and the same quality. The place has weathered a little bit as expected but if you want to stay at a place that is north of Houston, Chinatown, but in the mix of still funky NYC, then this is your best bet. Overall Off Soho is my first choice when returning to NYC.

I stayed at this hotel with my wife and friend for a concert in the area and it was a good find. I booked the hotel way in advance in September and had a price of $179 for a suite for 4 people. For the heck of it , I checked the website again the week before we went just to see if the hotel was sold out for the date we were going and it was not AND the price was $80 cheaper for the same room! Needless to say I cancelled the first reservation and booked again for the cheaper price; so if you are booking in advance check back on the website.Another weird thing was a booked with a discover card and when I arrived to check in they told me they do not except discover , only visa, mastercard and american express. Thank god I had another card but I found that strange and they gave no explanation to that issue.Other than that the room was ready early, the room was a nice size and clean, and the staff was pleasent.If asked if I would stay here again I would

Located a couple of blocks from a couple of subway stations, and in a part of town full of decent local bars and restaurants, alot more interesting that staying uptown around Times Square etc. Shopping as well is good... Lots of one off design and boutique type stores reminded me of Hoxton. Got a one bedroom apartment with kitchen and bathroom for good deal cheaper than many of the hotels on offer. Clean and comfortable, in fairly good state of repair. Not the smartest place I've stayed but nothing horrendous and certainly wouldn't put me off staying again.

As a previous hotel manager and travel agent I wouldn't necessarily recommend this hotel to my clients. But as I was travelling with my family of 5 this was a cheaper option than 2 hotel rooms.The location was fantastic and the lobby area and lounge were lovely.The room we stayed in was a little tired and could probably do with a spruce up.Overall reasonable value for the time of year we were there and staff friendly enough.Street appeal and the bar next door were very soho!

If you are looking for an unusually spacious and reasonably priced apartment in Manhattan, this hotel is a very good option.We stayed one week in an apartment at fourth floor, it was quiet, clean and, as mentioned before, very spacious with a bedroom, living room with a sofa, table and tv, a fully equipped kitchenette, big bathroom.The furniture is not new, but it's functional: The staff is kind and keep to help.Wifi was initially free, then changed to a different payment model the last day of our stay, so we can't tell the logic.The location is very good, walking distance from Little Italy, Chinatown, Soho, Brooklyn Bridge. There are several subway options to reach any area in Manhattan.There's plenty of great restaurants, pubs, bakeries (Eileen Cheesecake) and shops (Wholefoods Market one block away) in the area.

Sir Bani Yas Island, United Arab Emirates

review_body: We arrived late at night, staff was great assisting our arrival. It was great having the kitchen. There was a whole foods store very close. Would definitely choose staying here again next time we're in the city.

We stayed in a 1 bedroom suite. It was quiet and clean and having the kitchen was a massive bonus as we could make our own breakfast every day and dinners for the kids on a couple of occasions. It is only 3 blocks to Wholefoods too which is a big plus. Close to a number of train lines it was really easy to access.

Compared to other nyc hotels, the reviews for the Off SoHo Suites seemed too good to be true but I booked and hoped for the best. I'm glad I did because we were not disappointed! The overall atmosphere seems a little shady, the water pressure/temp were a bit brutal and the bed was pretty stiff but they're the only negative things I can say and none of them interrupted our stay much. The area is very different and refreshing compared to the craziness of the Times Square scene. Close to tons of bars, food spots and shopping. The suites are huge for NYC. We stayed in room 403 and had a bedroom, living room, full kitchen and a huge bathroom. There were also two full length mirrors which was a plus for us ladies. Everything was spotless!! We were not bothered by any neighbors and did not feel unsafe outside of the building. They were kind enough to let us check in super early and there were no hassles at the desk. Our expectations were beyond met and we will absolutely stay here again!

I was in NYC with my daughter and her friend, and wanted a suite vs a single room. They are hard to find in NYC, and pretty expensive. I got a one bedroom suite for a fantastic rate. The hotel was easy to find. Parking wasn't very close. The person at the front desk was on the phone, which is fine, but he didn't even acknowledge me even after he hung up. We were able to get into our room right away, even though we were early for check-in, so that was nice. We entered the room into a small kitchen and eating/living area, which contained a futon. The bedroom was off that. It can have two twins or a queen( which you need to chose prior to check-in). The bath was off the kitchen area. The decor was a bit tired, and not all the outlets worked. There was no clock in the bedroom, and the location of the outlet was at the foot of the bed, which was a bit odd. There was no carpet or rugs. The kitchen didn't have much in the way of utensils, cups, etc. Wifi was good in the living area, but not very good in the bedroom. The hotel was an easy walk to the subway, and a Whole Foods too. The rate I got was 1/3 less than the usual rate, and for that I'd stay again. For full and usual rate, I'm just not sure.

Off Soho is well located in lower east village, and handy for transport system.It is well located for walking to the village, Soho and Chinatown and so a fantastic range of eating and drinking within a short walk.It provides functional and clean accommodation as described in the hotel's particulars, but I would say the décor is looking dated and tired. All that said, beds are comfortable, the apartment is spacious, and the bathroom works, so no cause for complaint.We slept on the sixth floor, facing Rivington Street so you expect some street noise but the 24 hour builder's merchants was very irritating with fork lift trucks reversing throughout the night and lots of loud conversation. If you're going, ask for a back facing room!Other than that, go ahead. It's not luxurious, but does what it says on the tin, at a reasonable price.

We stayed 12 nights at Off SoHo in early October (3 adults and 1 child). For a Manhattan accommodation the size was unbelievable!! And the price is even better. The managers couldn't have been more accommodating (think cooking our pizza in another room when we couldn't get our oven to work while they waited on a repair) and Shannon the security guard was so friendly with great tips on where to eat and places to visit. He was always welcoming us with a smile or a high five and this place really did feel like home. Can't wait to go back. Will not stay anywhere else in NY. Great location. Close to 2 different subway lines. Check out Spring Street 1 block away. So much shopping and great eateries.

Entrance has a glass window where you talk to the staff so you do not walk into a lobby. It does not feel welcoming on arrival. If you've driven a car into the city there is no where to pull it aside to unload. The morning after I did find a very welcoming and warm lounge/living room area behind the entrance hallway. The room was also not very welcoming. Kitchen that we walked into was dated and worn, suite was uncomfortably warm with one window air conditioner that did not work. Towels in the bathroom were hard and sparse. On the plus side hotel was very clean. If there for an extended stay would be good to have a kitchen. Provided enough room for our family. Place felt better the next morning, but initial feeling was unwelcoming.

we booked this on the recommendation of the Time out guide. we were looking for a reasonably priced hotel in an interesting area of NYC. And so it proved to be.We had room 205 which had a large bedroom with air con and plenty of storage space and a very useful large safe ( it took a laptop), a living space with settee and table and a tall table with 4 stools, a kitchen with cooker microwave, fridge and pots pans etc so you could cook if you wanted and a large bathroom with bath. It was clean tidy and comfortable rather than chic or smart. Above all it was quiet!2 blocks north there is a Wholefood supermarket selling fantastic food for self catering.The hotel is really convenient for the Tenement museum, East Village, Soho, Tribeca and Greenwich all of which are easily walkable. The immediate area particularly around Spring Street station, Mott and Elizabeth Street offer lots of good restaurants and there is Chinatown and Little Italy nearby.

Nice to have space. But the wifi doesn't work so it's not really possible to stay here if you have any business to do. The staff leave new sheets on the door handle every day which is totally unnecessary. It would be much better to spend a bit more on a good internet provider and cut back on changing the sheets every day!

The Off Soho suites were like small apartments with a separate bedroom, lounge area with a kitchenette and bathroom. They more than met our needs for our week in New York City with space, friendly service and well serviced rooms.The apartments were within walking distance of the subway (several lines) and a whole foods supermarket.The apartments are a little bit dated and you have to make your own beds (linen provided) but for the price and fantastic service we received we were more than happy to stay here and would recommend this to others travelling on a budget. The wifi was poor but sitting in the corridor we got fair service.

This was an interesting property. The room was a suite, with a kitchen, bathroom, living room, and bedroom. I liked that there was lots of space and that there was a full fridge/freezer. It was decorated nicely and the paint was fresh. The hotel staff in the lobby were friendly. But, it was old in the corners. The pillows were uncomfortable. The towels were minimal. The bed wasn't even made when I got to my room (meaning, the sheet and blanket were folded on top of the bed). They offered some conditioner and shampoo, and the conditioner was half used. I guess it would be ok for a reasonable price, but because it was a busy week, the price was way too high for what it is. I would stay there again, because I like the location and I felt safe, but there are better options out there. Oh...they offered one code for free WiFi (and one paid). The WiFi was terrible in the room.

Off Soho Suites located in a quiet street, central to the Bowery, Broadway and Little Italy? The apartment was spacious, clean and with good aircon units! Staff were friendly and helpful. We stayed here for two weeks and felt like we became part of the neighbourhood! There are so many great eating places within easy walking distance. Little Italy for great food and atmosphere, The Butchers Daughter for amazing brunch and lunch and probably dinners but we ran out of time to go there for dinner! La Cerviche for stunning tapas.

Off Soho Suites is truly among the rarer bargains that New York is offering these days--and that is from the perspective of a former City resident. The hotel is a nice and charming-with Henry Rollins and several other great artists among its guests. The hotel offers a clean one bedroom apartment unit with kitchen and good security. There is a functional fitness room in the basement along with coin-op laundry and vending machines.The beds and ample supply of linens, bathroom, kitchen, and floors were all clean. There was a futon in the unit so as to accommodate 4 people which was perfect for a family. And the staff was very professional, helpful, and courteous as well. The staff recommended parking is affordable and a short walk from the hotel. Off Soho is set between Chrystie and the Bowery in what today is called NoLita. It is a short walk from Little Italy, Chinatown, Soho, Alphabet City, and the East Village and convenient to much of Manhattan and Brooklyn via the subway or a short taxi fare. Directly surrounding the hotel are a very good ice cream parlor, coffee shops, and pubs as well as the hipster oriented shops and galleries, plus the enduring Bowery staples of restaurant supply stores. The area is no doubt changing rapidly -becoming gentrified ala the 2000s East Village. I felt a parallel universe moment seeing the Bowery this way-Hipsters replacing the junkies, hobos, giant rats, concert posters and grunge. But times change and that's alright with me. In consideration of the City's rapidly disappearing bargains and the equally rapidly disappearing mom and pop stores, greasy spoons, and bargain clothing stores --once a staple in this great city, I would highly recommend Off Soho Suites to anyone looking for a reliable clean and affordable place to stay in New York.

Visited NYC in February with a couple friends. We're in university and found the Off Soho Suites online to be the cheapest hotel on the island. We all really enjoyed our stay for the price we paid. The beds were comfortable and the staff was very accommodating! Our one bedroom suite was spacious and mostly clean. Great location just off Bowery near the New Museum and lots of trendy little spots in walking distance. Will recommend to friends travelling to NYC on a budget!

This hotel is definitely spacey and clean, it was just a little dated. The towels were hard and the kitchen could use a remodel. But the AC was on point the beds were comfty. The neighborhood is ok during the day but a little iffy at night, homeless people close by. But I guess that's what you get in NYC.

The room was quite comfortable. Pretty good size It was very hot out but the AC's kept room nice and cool. The gentleman who checked us in was very helpful. Only drawback was parking. No garage too close. Wi-Fi was spotty at best.

For the price you can't beat this for a family room. Close to the J and Z lines which take you to JFK, and not far from little Italy and some great boutique shops.We had a bedroom and a separate lounge, with a sofa bed. The rooms were clean, so pretty much all goodThe guy checking us in couldn't have been more helpful and friendly. The guy checking us out probably needs a bit of customer care training, but it didn't affect the stay.Would thoroughly recommend.

I had to take a last minute business trip with my two business partners. We needed a place in the city that would sleep 3, and we wanted to conserve money. Found this place and the experience was perfect. Older hotel, but had a great vibe, on a cool little side street in Soho. Rolf at the front was great. Helped get us a place to park the car $35 a night. Loved the location. Walked to some cool restaurants, and off the beaten path stores. The Suite slept the 3 of us comfortably, had a full size fridge, and stove. It was like a great apartment in the city. Booked it online and saved $80 for the night. I will definitely stay here again. Free Wifi not that strong so bring a booster if you need high speed. They had a paid option, which may have been better but we opted out.

I have been to New York before and chose this place in this area on purpose. Last time we stayed up by Times Square and felt we just didn't get the "real" New York.I also chose this place with the 4th of July firework display in mind as we could walk to the event.On arrival we were met and checked in by a very nice man, check in was quick and we went to our apartment. The apartment was spacious, clean and with two air conditioning units, cool! The bathroom was very large and again clean, shower, fabulous. The beds were super comfortable and crisp white sheets.The only issue had was the initial smell, previous guests must have been cooking with lots of spice but this did disappear when the air con units were on. Kitchen was clean and plenty utensils. There is no welcome pack with coffee filters or salt and pepper, you need to buy them all. There is a market shop close by but if you walk up to Houston St. and Bowery there is a Whole Foods Supermarket full of very lovely foods. The wifi is very slow too bus accessible in certain areas of the apartment.The city sightseeing bus also stops and pick up near by and is an ideal way of getting round. The local restaurants are that, local full of atmosphere and fantastic food. Galli, along from the suites was excellent.

review_body: We truly enjoyed our stay...Shannon was kind and curteous! Thanks Shannon from all the way from Texas! Our room was clean and comfortable...not too far from NYC sites...look foward to staying here again!

I was with my young children & my family friend (total 6 adults, 3 children). Its in downtown and area is pretty close to Uptown and downtown as well. SERvices were good and also clean kitchen apartment.I would recommend this for as it is a good value back.

If you are looking for the "spice" of NY .. Soho, Chinatown, little Italy and surrounding areas then Soho is the place to go.. And the place to stay is the OFF SOHO SUITES. We have been guests of Off Soho for 10 years running, a minimum of twice per year. We even survived hurricane Sandy with the most excellent service imaginable by the hotel. All the suites have full kitchen services, very well maintained and clean and air conditioned with a private bedroom, furnished living room. The personalities of management and staff are welcoming and become part of the family.I give the hotel a 5 star rating because of the overall experience.. I would highly recommend staying here, in the heart of NY..

If you don't care that everything is bright and shiny, this is a good budget option in the Soho-Village-Chinatown area. Accommodations are utilitarian but having the kitchen and room to spread out a bit is a great feature. Two of us couples stayed over the weekend in a suite with a queen and fold down futon/sofa bed. We were relatively comfortable the whole time.

We got to this hotel because of a special price we got online. At first we were not completely happy (the location looked dark and messy at night) but then we realized it's just two blocks from Little Italy and a couple from the subway. The service of the hotel itself was pretty decent.

You simply can't beat the Lower East SIde location. It is close to Little Italy,Chinatown, the train (subway) and the East Village, . The staff was friendly and helpful and the very clean and spacious apartment was a bargain for New York City. I absolutely loved our sparkling and homey suite. This will be the only place I stay in New York if I go back..My only slight quibble was that our upstairs neighbor was somewhat noisy. It sounded like he was dropping a safe on our ceiling at 6;30 every morning. (Not really the fault of the management,). It is just an older building. This is my favorite hotel experience ever.

San Antonio, Texas, United States

review_body: Off soho Suites was a wonderful boutique hotel in the lower east side of nyc! It's just close enough to little Italy, n Chinatown but not too far from the craziness of Times Square! I truly enjoyed the hotel. Beds were comfortable, kitchen was just enough, and the staff was very friendly

Really Nice stay at the Soho suites. The room is of a good size. Big bedroom and bathroom ( great shower), living and enough placed to sit. Also a big kitchen,only almost no kitchen supplies. Really good and budget option to stay with friends or family!

I love Off Soho SuitesI had, at this time.(Summer 2014) never been in NY before.Lived in Columbus OH where we had the best friends. We arrived to this hotel 5 hours late, In the middle of the night. They greeted us. And they were always the very best throughout our experience. This hotel is the best.The owners are Egyptians, and still today I honour them for the way they talked to my daugther who speaks Libanese.And the way they treated us all. So good people!Trip talk: 1 good 2 bed with a closing door. 1 kitchen/kids bedroom with a table to sit down and talk.And outdoor space, Not much kitchen utensils.

We stayed for 9 days and the cost and location were great. Access to the Subways were close and great shopping was also within easy walking.The rooms were plain and dated but had lots of space and the kitchen unit was a great asset. The Hotel staff were great and Gabe was exceptional. He was very friendly and always checking to see how our stay was and if we needed anything. Gabe also provided information on great eating places and was right on with his recommendations. The washing machines were out of orde while we were there but we survived without them. Again Gabe was helpful and gave me directions to where I could get laundry done a short distance away.If you want a clean and economical place to stay this is it.

Nice place to stay. Convenient location, close to the Little Italy and Chinatown. Clean rooms. Nice staff. Price was good, around 160$/per room/per night. In fact, you rent small studios with kitchen. Good value but nothing chic.
